cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 miles ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift northwest today, accelerate north-northwest tonight, then turn north and hug the Georgia/South Carolina coastline before recurving northeastward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall currently forecast; closest coastal encounter is just offshore the Georgia coast near Brunswick

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical-Storm Warning); Lantana FL to Savannah River (Storm-Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Wednesday night–Thursday with a 12 % chance of 50-kt (≥58 mph) gusts; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center wobbles closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level is possible along the Georgia coast, including the Port of Brunswick, beginning late Wednesday and persisting into Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches, locally up to 9 inches, could fall across coastal Georgia producing flash-flood potential at and near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal erosion, and a low tornado risk on outer rainbands.
